revised_title: Clinton Coleridge Farr: A Pioneering Scientist in Terrestrial Magnetism
tldr: Clinton Coleridge Farr was a prominent scientist in the field of terrestrial magnetism, conducting groundbreaking research in New Zealand and Antarctica. His work laid the foundation for future studies of Earth's magnetic field and contributed to the understanding of its variations. Farr also played a significant role in promoting science education and research in New Zealand, earning recognition from the Royal Society.
